definition: to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: Three of us sweep and mop the floor and the remainder clean the window.
sentences.chinese: 我們之中三人掃地拖地板，其餘的人擦玻璃。

sentences.english: She's been nagging at him to mop the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她一直羅羅唆唆地催他去拖地板。

sentences.english: Having cleaned the window, she began to wash the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她擦完窗戶之後開始拖地板。

sentences.english: So, Maria started to wash the floor, while the nurse was looking on.
sentences.chinese: 就這樣，Maria開始拖地板，而護士在一旁看着。

sentences.english: On Sundays, she often washes some clothes and mops the floor.
sentences.chinese: 星期天，她通常是洗洗衣服，拖拖地板。

sentences.english: Gordon mops the floor every Saturday .
The task includes sweeping the floor and cleaning the windows.
sentences.chinese: 任務包括拖地板和擦窗子。

sentences.english: She knew firsthand how hard it was to mop the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她知道用Firsthand來拖地板是特別累人。

sentences.english: While she is cleaning the window, he mop the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她在擦窗時，他在拖地板。

definition: to mop the floor/(of a gown etc) to trail on the ground/full-length
to water the plants/to water the garden
to sweep the floor/to reach rock bottom/to be at an all-time low
to pick the edible part of vegetables
to rub oneself down with a wet towel/to take a sponge bath
